properties.areaDesc: Pickens, AL; Marengo, AL; Greene, AL; Hale, AL; Sumter, AL
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:17AM CST until February 20 at 4:21AM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock
and Dam, Demopolis Lock and Dam, and Gainesville Lock and Dam...

.Moderate flood stage continues at river forecast locations along
the Tombigbee River. However, levels at Bevill Lock and Dam are
expected to fall below moderate flood this afternoon, and below
flood stage by Wednesday based on the latest forecast.

Gainesville Lock and Dam is currently cresting this morning, but
will remain in moderate flood stage through at least Wednesday
morning.

Demopolis Lock and Dam still has not reached its crest, and is
expected to rise close to 85 feet by Tuesday morning. The last time
Demopolis rose over 85 feet was on May 27, 1983.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam.
* until late Wednesday night...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  9:00 AM Monday the stage was 135.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 122 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to below flood stage by
Wednesday afternoon.
* Impact...At 135 feet...Widespread flooding of farm and
pasturelands...as well as cabins and camps near the river...will
occur. Flooding of some homes in the Rivermont Subdivision of
Pickensville will occur.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning...or sooner if
conditions warrant.
